etymology.description: 目(目) (mù, "eye") + 人(人) (rén, "person") = a person looking back -> concept of disobedience or limit
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 目(目) (mù, "eye") and 人(人) (rén, "person") suggests the idea of a person looking back, symbolizing stubbornness or defiance, as they resist moving forward or following others.

examples.chinese: 他很艮(他很艮)，不轻易改变主意(不輕易改變主意)。
examples.pinyin: Tā hěn gèn, bù qīngyì gǎibiàn zhǔyì.
examples.english: He is very stubborn, unwilling to change his mind.

examples.chinese: 他的脾气很艮(他的脾氣很艮)，不容易妥协(不容易妥協)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de píqì hěn gèn, bù róngyì tuǒxié.
examples.english: His temper is stubborn, making him hard to compromise.
